name: Fedora Utils
body:
To install the latest version of Fedora Utils in your system, run the following in the Terminal,

`su -c "curl http://master.dl.sourceforge.net/project/fedorautils/fedorautils.repo -o /etc/yum.repos.d/fedorautils.repo && yum install fedorautils`

Adding the Fedora Utils repo to your system to ensures that Fedora Utils up-to-date and all the new features and bug fixes are delivered to you. If you don't want the repo, you can remove it from the "Help" menu in Fedora Utils.

Fedora Utils saves the downloaded files for so that you can reuse them. It also takes backups before modifying system files for easy recovery. Unlike others, it can perform batch operations too.

You can also extend the functionality of Fedora Utils by plugins. Writing a plugin is easy and fun. Visit the [wiki](https://github.com/satya164/fedorautils/wiki) to have an idea.

Feel free to make modifications and contributions. Fedora Utils is released under GNU GPL V3.0 and the source code is publicly available. You can access the public repository and commit fixes and improvements, and even fork it.

`git clone git@github.com:satya164/fedorautils.git`

If you like Fedora Utils, please support us by spreading the word.

You can catch me on [Google+](http://plus.google.com/114564489020097923600) or [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/satya164). Also check my [blog](http://funsurf-blog.blogspot.com/) and [deviantArt](http://satya164.deviantart.com/) page :)
tagline: Fedora Utils lets you install codecs and additional software, fix problems, tweak and cleanup your system, view system information and much more with just few clicks.
